filmography.title: Lawrence of Arabia
filmography.role_description: A flamboyant and controversial British military officer who unites the Arab tribes against the Turks during World War I.
filmography.plot: The story of T.E. Lawrence, the English officer who successfully united and led the diverse, often warring, Arab tribes during World War I in order to fight the Turks.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; BAFTA: Win – Best British Actor

filmography.title: Becket
filmography.role_description: The King of England who appoints his close friend as Archbishop of Canterbury, only to find their friendship shattered by religious duty.
filmography.plot: King Henry II surprises England by naming his drinking partner Thomas Becket as Archbishop of Canterbury, but their friendship turns to bitter rivalry.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor (Drama)

filmography.title: Lord Jim
filmography.role_description: A merchant seaman labeled a coward after abandoning a sinking ship who seeks redemption in the jungles of Southeast Asia.
filmography.plot: After being discredited as a coward, a 19th-century seaman lives for only one purpose: to redeem himself.

filmography.title: What's New Pussycat?
filmography.role_description: A notorious fashion editor and womanizer who seeks psychiatric help to remain faithful to his fiancée.
filmography.plot: A playboy who refuses to give up his hedonistic lifestyle to settle down and marry his true love seeks help from a demented psychoanalyst.

filmography.title: How to Steal a Million
filmography.role_description: A dashing society burglar who is hired by a woman to steal her father's fake sculpture from a museum to save the family reputation.
filmography.plot: A woman who must steal a statue from a Paris museum to help conceal her father's art forgeries is assisted by a man.

filmography.title: The Night of the Generals
filmography.role_description: A fanatical, ruthless Nazi general who becomes a prime suspect in a murder investigation spanning decades.
filmography.plot: A German intelligence officer investigates a murder of a prostitute in Warsaw, in which three generals are the main suspects.
filmography.awards: David di Donatello: Win – Best Foreign Actor

filmography.title: The Lion in Winter
filmography.role_description: Reprising the role of Henry II as an aging king battling his wife and sons over the succession to the throne.
filmography.plot: 1183 AD: King Henry II's three sons all want to inherit the throne, but he won't commit to a choice.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor (Drama)

filmography.title: Goodbye, Mr. Chips
filmography.role_description: A shy, conservative Latin schoolmaster whose life is transformed when he falls in love with a showgirl.
filmography.plot: A shy, withdrawn English schoolteacher falls for a flashy showgirl, an event that transforms his life.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor (Musical/Comedy)

filmography.title: Murphy's War
filmography.role_description: The sole survivor of a WWII U-boat attack who becomes obsessed with sinking the submarine that killed his crewmates.
filmography.plot: A World War II seaman plots to get even with the crew of a German U-boat that sank his ship.

filmography.title: The Ruling Class
filmography.role_description: A paranoid schizophrenic British aristocrat who inherits an earldom and believes he is Jesus Christ.
filmography.plot: A member of the House of Lords dies, leaving his estate to his son, a mesmerizingly insane 14th Earl of Gurney who believes he is Jesus Christ.

filmography.title: Man of La Mancha
filmography.role_description: The delusional knight-errant who fights windmills and dreams the impossible dream in this musical adaptation.
filmography.plot: The film version of the musical play about Don Quixote, the mad knight who fights windmills and sees beauty in a serving wench.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Win – Best Actor

filmography.title: Under Milk Wood
filmography.role_description: A blind, retired sea captain who dreams of his drowned shipmates in this adaptation of Dylan Thomas's play.
filmography.plot: A visual recreation of Dylan Thomas's radio play about the inhabitants of a sleepy Welsh village.

filmography.title: Zulu Dawn
filmography.role_description: The arrogant British commander who underestimates the Zulu forces, leading to the disastrous Battle of Isandlwana.
filmography.plot: A dramatization of the Battle of Isandlwana in 1879, where British troops suffered a massive defeat against Zulu warriors.

filmography.title: Caligula
filmography.role_description: The aging, depraved Roman Emperor who passes the throne to his even more unstable grandson.
filmography.plot: The rise and fall of the notorious Roman Emperor Caligula.

filmography.title: The Stunt Man
filmography.role_description: A tyrannical, manipulative film director who will risk anyone's life to get the perfect shot.
filmography.plot: A fugitive stumbles onto a movie set and is manipulated by the director into replacing a stunt man who was killed.

filmography.title: My Favorite Year
filmography.role_description: A washed-up, alcoholic swashbuckling movie star who causes chaos while guest-starring on a 1950s TV comedy show.
filmography.plot: A young comedy writer is tasked with keeping a dissolute movie idol sober during his appearance on a variety show.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actor

filmography.title: Supergirl
filmography.role_description: A Kryptonian artist and mentor to Supergirl who accidentally loses the Omegahedron that powers their city.
filmography.plot: Supergirl travels to Earth to recover a powerful orb and save her home, battling a witch in the process.

filmography.title: Creator
filmography.role_description: An eccentric Nobel Prize-winning biologist obsessed with cloning his deceased wife.
filmography.plot: A university professor attempts to clone his wife who died 30 years earlier, while mentoring a young student.

filmography.title: The Last Emperor
filmography.role_description: The Scottish tutor to the young Emperor Pu Yi who opens his eyes to the outside world.
filmography.plot: The story of the final Emperor of China, from his ascent to the throne as a small boy to his imprisonment and political rehabilitation.

filmography.title: High Spirits
filmography.role_description: The desperate owner of an Irish castle who markets it as 'haunted' to attract American tourists, only to wake actual ghosts.
filmography.plot: When a hotel owner tries to fill vacancies by advertising his castle as haunted, the real ghosts show up to cause trouble.

filmography.title: King Ralph
filmography.role_description: The dignified royal secretary who must teach an American lounge singer how to be the King of England.
filmography.plot: An American lounge singer unexpectedly becomes the King of England after the entire royal family is electrocuted.

filmography.title: FairyTale: A True Story
filmography.role_description: The famous author and spiritualist who investigates claims of fairies being photographed by two young girls.
filmography.plot: Two young girls in 1917 England take photographs that appear to show fairies, attracting the attention of Sir Arthur Conan Doyle and Harry Houdini.

filmography.title: Phantoms
filmography.role_description: An academic researcher of mass disappearances who helps a group of survivors fight an ancient shapeshifting entity.
filmography.plot: In the peaceful town of Snowfield, Colorado, something evil has wiped out the community, and a small group of people must stop it.

filmography.title: Troy
filmography.role_description: The aging King of Troy who pleads with Achilles for the return of his son Hector's body in a moving scene.
filmography.plot: An adaptation of Homer's great epic, the film follows the assault on Troy by the united Greek forces and chronicles the fates of the men involved.

filmography.title: Lassie
filmography.role_description: A wealthy landowner who buys the beloved collie Lassie, but later helps facilitate her return to her original family.
filmography.plot: A family in financial crisis is forced to sell their beloved dog, Lassie, who embarks on a long journey to return to them.

filmography.title: Venus
filmography.role_description: An elderly, ailing actor who forms a poignant, platonic bond with the wayward grand-niece of his friend.
filmography.plot: A pair of veteran actors find their comfortable daily routine turned upside down by the arrival of a brazen young woman.

filmography.title: Ratatouille
filmography.role_description: The imperious, grim food critic whose Rediscovery of childhood joy through food provides the film's emotional climax.
filmography.plot: A rat who can cook makes an unusual alliance with a young kitchen worker at a famous Paris restaurant.

filmography.title: Stardust
filmography.role_description: The dying king who sets his sons on a murderous quest for the crown by throwing a ruby into the sky.
filmography.plot: In a countryside town bordering on a magical land, a young man makes a promise to his beloved that he'll retrieve a fallen star by venturing into the magical realm.

filmography.title: Dean Spanley
filmography.role_description: A curmudgeonly father who reconnects with his son through a bizarre encounter with a cleric who may be a reincarnated dog.
filmography.plot: In Edwardian England, a father and son visit a peculiar cleric who claims to be the reincarnation of a dog.
